alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:52PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL HOWARD AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MARYLAND... SOUTH CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... NORTHEASTERN LOUDOUN AND NORTH CENTRAL FAIRFAX COUNTIES IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA... At 352 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Point Of Rocks to Poolesville to Lansdowne, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Germantown, Rockville, Bethesda, Gaithersburg, Leesburg, Olney, Damascus, Broadlands, Lansdowne, Lowes Island, Poolesville, Aspen Hill, Potomac, North Bethesda, Ashburn, Montgomery Village, Sterling, North Potomac and Fairland. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
